page.title: 01Dunoon On The Firth Of Clyde
page.content: Dunoon situated on the Cowal Peninsula of South Argyll forms the largest town in the area. It is normally reached by sea ferry from Gourock and when approached from the sea it is seen to be low lying and situated on a small promontory jutting into the Firth of Clyde. The town is backed by a range of steep tree clad hills. There are no large industrial or manufacturing concerns in the area and with the exception of some large hotels the majority of the buildings of the town are of one or two stories in height. The main business of the town is tourism and accordingly much of the work is of a seasonal nature. At present the town slao serves as a dormitory area for USA navy personnel and their families based at the nearby Holy Loch Submarine base.
